result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Ronald Wayne Drost was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant to complete 38 hours community service in lieu of $550.60 fine, to be completed within 6 months.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ronald Wayne Drost

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Drug Court completed

Defendant Ronald Wayne Drost in court.  Perry L Folts appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant completed Drug Court.  Court imposes guilty judgment on count 1, orders 38 hours community service in lieu of $550.60 fine; community service to be completed within 6 months.  Court vacates plea on counts 2-4; counts 2-4 dismissed.
